column1: As Pfizer announces it’s intent to seek an FDA permit for use of their COVID vaccine it’s critical that we have an efficient distribution plan in place. Thanks to Operation Warp Speed much of that work has been completed. https://t.co/gmPAprUlVF

Gov. Newsom’s decision to double-down on his failure to properly manage COVID in state prisons by releasing dangerous criminals onto our streets without coordinating with local law enforcement has tragically ended with deadly results. https://t.co/DumCho1XTV
I appreciate the hard work by the VA to prepare for the safe and equitable distribution of a COVID vaccine to our nation’s veterans. https://t.co/1YvOt9W5n0

Between COVID relief finalizing the FY2021 appropriations bills and passing a defense authorization bill the House has a lot to do. Speaker Pelosi needs to stop pursuing a radical agenda. Republicans are ready to work for the American people. #LetsWork https://t.co/OHrPffQ7Rs

In April the Trump admin's Operation Warp Speed program partnered w/ Moderna to develop a COVID vaccine. Today’s news that the vaccine is 94% effective is promising news that a safe vaccine is just around the corner thanks to the efforts of all involved. https://t.co/KseSY7BBzo
Good news for Riverside County commuters. Thanks again to the Greater Corona Traffic Alliance for their advocacy of this project and to @TheRCTC for making it happen. https://t.co/CTal9dvWrl

Today’s positive news about  Pfizer’s COVID vaccine is a testament to the dedicated work of the scientists and everyone involved with its development. Thanks to the thousands of trial participants we know a safe and effective vaccine is within reach.
Thank you @CoronaFireDept! https://t.co/SJeBTljjel

The FDA has fully approved the first drug to treat COVID-19. A study by the NIH has proven that remdesivir has cut the virus recovery time by 5 days on average. Improved therapeutics are helping us drive down the length of hospital stays and death rates. https://t.co/GbXJ1tnnxf
I’m disappointed Senate Democrats once again blocked COVID relief for Americans in need. https://t.co/SRPg4YFgB8

COVID-related deaths hospitalizations and ICU bed utilization rates are some of the most important factors for monitoring the health impact of this virus. In Riverside County all of these rates have fallen dramatically over the past few months and are stable. https://t.co/SCUeomHU10

Gov. Newsom is once again shutting down Riv. Co. businesses churches and schools. County health officials confirmed today there’s NOT a COVID surge at our hospitals.   We have to learn to live SAFELY with the virus & can’t keep changing the rules for businesses every few weeks. https://t.co/Cz0X6AmjIh
I joined my fellow Corona Rotarians at lunch today and led the pledge to the greatest nation to ever exist! 🇺🇸 https://t.co/GZ71kRgo8p

It was great to start the day at the Corona Chamber of Commerce’s Good Morning Corona breakfast. As a former small business owner I know our job creators are struggling and I’m committed to working with them to get through our challenges. https://t.co/npqjF7fvFL
A new Yale University study of more than 57000 child care centers has found that children in day-care programs present virtually no risk of transmitting COVID-19 to adults. https://t.co/eW2EwTyHHw

I’ll say it again – the only thing standing between the American people and COVID relief is Speaker Pelosi. Even CNN and her fellow Democrats don’t understand her reluctance to help families in need. https://t.co/1nwNlONqor

This week I was honored to meet in Corona with Maj. Gen. William “Butch” Graham deputy commanding general for civil and emergency operations U.S. Army Corps of Engineers Headquarters to discuss the Santa Ana River Mainstem project & the Murrieta Creek flood control project. https://t.co/DilwwkGeax
There are currently 652 Californians in the ICU with COVID. That’s the lowest number since March 30th.

Science shows kids learn best in classrooms.   Science shows young children are not as susceptible to COVID.   Let’s follow the science take appropriate safety measures and at a minimum get our young children back in classrooms. Their education is too important. https://t.co/5HtoxDhhji

We’ve got to get our economy open again and kids back in schools. Wear a mask. Social distance. Get a flu shot. Keep yourself and your family healthy so we can grow our economy and secure a brighter future for our children.

Speaker Pelosi has insisted that any COVID relief bill include a complete rewrite of our election laws even though people are already voting and she’s insisting on special interest carve outs. In fact her bill mentions “cannabis” more than “jobs.”

That’s why it’s critical for Congress to once again come to a bipartisan agreement on COVID relief for Americans in need. Speaker Pelosi may think she’s scoring political points with her “my way or the highway” approach but it’s hurting families who are desperate for help.
Like everyone affected by COVID-19 I’m hoping President Trump and the First Lady have a full and quick recovery from the virus.

As a Congressional Coalition on Adoption member it was my honor to nominate the Avant-Garde Foster Family Agency located in Corona to be honored among the @CCAInstitute 2020 Angels in Adoption. Congratulations and thank you for making a difference in the lives of children! https://t.co/OJGpETw9JI

Speaker Pelosi’s latest COVID-19 relief bill is the same recycled liberal “wish list” that even House Democrats admitted was an overreach and prevented bipartisan consensus on real solutions for Americans in need.
I appreciate the work of the Coronavirus Task Force to get these rapid tests out across the nation to help the safe re-opening of our classrooms. https://t.co/tNKOI36zkU

The number of people in Riverside County ICUs with COVID-19 has dropped below 40 for the first time since April 1st. Keep taking appropriate steps to stay safe and healthy so we can continue to re-open our economy get people back to work and re-open our schools.

Federal agencies have coordinated the donation of 1899 cases (40 vials per case) of Remdesivir directly from the manufacturer and 3228 cases of commercially available Remdesivir to treat hospitalized COVID-19 patients in California.

The federal government has directly supported 121 community based COVID testing sites in CA and will be providing 1000000 swabs and 1000000 media to support state testing needs throughout the month of September.   Find a testing site here: https://t.co/odF9sWixxt
Op-ed from the GOP Doctors Caucus: Coronavirus vaccine -- we'll get one and here's why we trust the science https://t.co/gXf6mI84gA

When it was first released House Dems like Rep. Katie Porter criticized Speaker Pelosi’s COVID relief bill calling it a “Democratic wish list.” Now Pelosi is rejecting pleas by more Dems to stop playing politics. Pelosi is the only one blocking this aid from American families. https://t.co/Ii9zdOO8G5

.@HUDgov has awarded the third tranche of Community Development Block Grant funding from the CARES Act which I supported. Here’s a breakdown of the funding heading to the 42nd District: ▶️ Corona - $935657 ▶️ Menifee - $404459 ▶️ Temecula - $864764 ▶️ Riverside Co. - $5.6M
Promising news on the COVID-19 vaccine development front - Large antibody study offers hope for virus vaccine efforts https://t.co/XIbbBUJJAe

The owner of Hunny's Restaurant in Corona told my office that PPP “helped bring our loyal employees back to work. We were also able to pay our rent and utilities. I don’t want to think where we would be without the PPP.”

There is a growing consensus among researchers that young children aren’t coronavirus “super-spreaders” and that their return to classrooms is unlikely to change the course of the pandemic even in places where overall transmission is high. https://t.co/0YK9IfqUJx

Speaker Pelosi’s COVID relief bill is so unserious and unfocused on the crisis she’s already said she’s willing to drop $1 TRILLION from it. Why was that wasteful spending even in her bill in the first place? It’s time for Democrats to get serious about spending YOUR tax dollars.

In Riverside County today the number of people hospitalized with COVID is down 60% from its peak in mid-July.   Keep doing what you’ve been doing to protect yourself and others so we can move towards a further reopening of schools and businesses in a safe manner.

The construction of a new westbound lane on the 91 freeway is welcome news for Riverside County commuters. I appreciate the leadership of the Greater Corona Traffic Alliance for its advocay of the project and RCTC for making it happen. https://t.co/0sy4SU3W0q

The FDA continues to review and approve COVID testing technologies at an unprecedented pace. Rapid paper tests which don’t need to be sent to labs are the next promising innovation that can be quickly scaled up in production to help with re-opening our economy and schools. https://t.co/OOZzWXXThn

The FDA’s approval of the SalivaDirect COVID-19 test marks another innovative rapid testing technology breakthrough that is essential for safely re-opening our economy and schools. https://t.co/xhAUXzSe2Y

Gov. Newsom must address the COVID-19 challenges in our prisons. Releasing inmates convicted of “first-degree murder carjacking and kidnapping” onto the streets of our neighborhoods is NOT a responsible answer.  https://t.co/MyYnnbj3E6

Have you recovered from COVID-19 and tested negative? If so please consider donating your plasma to help save others. To learn how please visit the @lifestreamblood website here: https://t.co/jCfRrKPrTf

This article highlights the Riverside County impact of the Paycheck Protection Program on workers and small businesses:  ✅ 262727 jobs saved ✅ 24000 businesses received loans ✅ 20000 loans were under $150k ✅ Corona businesses received the most loans https://t.co/hS0gtx4T1b

Even liberal House Democrats like Rep. Katie Porter have slammed Speaker Pelosi’s COVID-19 relief bill as a “Democratic wish list.”   This isn’t the time for partisan priorities.   It’s time to put the American people first. https://t.co/TiL6fqJ1KJ
What do you want to see in a COVID-19 relief bill?   Take a quick survey here: https://t.co/ZswmVHQ2ar
Operation Warp Speed continues to take important steps to have COVID-19 vaccines and therapies ready for wide distribution as soon as they’re proven safe and effective. https://t.co/XlYhfqp1KS

If there’s anything more reckless than releasing 8000 inmates in communities around California it’s releasing COVID-19 positive inmates in communities around California. This is a dangerous and outrageous move by Gov. Newsom. https://t.co/J0hDmBMZHM

Let’s remember just how unserious House Democrats were when they passed a so-called COVID-19 relief bill that included a new federal election law scheme that legalizes ballot harvesting as well as benefits for lobbyists and the cannabis industry.

Time after time Congressional Democrats have shown they are more interested in politics and the upcoming election than finding bipartisan solutions. If they refuse to come to a bipartisan agreement COVID-19 relief will not become law.

The final phase of testing for the COVID-19 vaccine jointly created by the @NIH and Moderna began today with the first of 30000 planned volunteers helping to test the vaccine receiving a treatment.  https://t.co/uz60lqbCNC
COVID-19 relief legislation must help Americans get safely back to work and support families in need during this economic crisis.

Attempts by hackers in China to steal COVID-19 vaccine and therapeutic research from American biotech companies are shameful and must be met with serious consequences including sanctions on the Chinese Communist Party if they fail to stop this activity.
#CA42Heroes: Temescal Canyon HS senior Athena Strecker has spent her extra time during the COVID-19 pandemic sewing and delivering free masks to her community. https://t.co/1SKjKrUvxV

Here are my priorities for next COVID-19 aid bill:  ✅ Keep Americans healthy by supporting our health care system and the development of therapies and vaccines ✅ Support American workers and small businesses ✅ Safety for kids teachers and schools

As we work on the next COVID-19 aid package Congress must continue to make therapy and vaccine development a top health priority to ensure Americans have access to them as soon as they are proven safe and effective.
A COVID-19 vaccine being developed by Oxford University and AstraZeneca has shown promising immune system responses in a large early-stage trial. https://t.co/WSuVscMbzq

A protein treatment being developed by Synairgen that is inhaled directly into the lungs of COVID-19 patients using a nebulizer reduced the odds of hospitalized patients developing severe complications and requiring ventilation by 79%. https://t.co/6Fl6IgDOpa
There are promising reports being released today about therapies and vaccines to address the COVID-19 pandemic. ⤵️
@CoronaPD Update: The individual is now in Lake Elsinore and being monitored by the deputies from the Lake Elsinore Sheriff’s Station. https://t.co/9Y3RQXv8EH
An important safety alert for Corona and Riverside County residents. Thank you @CoronaPD for keeping the community safe and informed. https://t.co/Wgtm5pMU43

If small businesses are doing the right things in complying with CDC and local health requirements they shouldn’t be vulnerable to frivolous lawsuits. That’s why I’ve cosponsored H.R. 6664 the Coronavirus Public Safety and Economic Recovery Act to provide liability protection.

As we approach the weekend with COVID-19 cases & hospital utilization rates spiking in CA it’s critical for everyone to take responsibility for their own actions. Protect yourself and others by wearing a mask in public avoid large gatherings and stay home if you’re sick.

.@GavinNewsom declared a COVID-19 emergency on March 3rd. It’s now July 16th and many school districts start the school year in early August. Not only do districts not have guidance from the state the state can’t even provide a firm date when to expect it. A total failure. https://t.co/JfxuvO6NEp

Gov. Newsom’s failure to manage & contain COVID-19 in our state prisons is now about to make our communities less safe & put additional burdens on Riv. Co. law enforcement. Keep in mind CA Democrats have weakened the definition of a “violent crime." https://t.co/nOiRTNQSrP
Welcome news from @US_FDA. Congress must continue to support the promising efforts to develop COVID-19 therapies and vaccines. https://t.co/rFTBil1cHT

We all need to do our part to stop the spread of COVID-19. Many small businesses in CA have invested time & money to find innovative ways to protect employees and customers. We need to find ways to allow these good examples to stay open not blindly treat all businesses the same.

The special U.S.-Israel relationship includes the exchange of science + technology to the benefit of both nations. I have agreed to cosponsor H.R. 6829 to create a  U.S.-Israel cooperative grant program to leverage American/Israeli health care research to combat COVID-19.

If you’ve recently tested positive for COVID-19 you can help stop the spread of the virus by isolating at home and cooperating with contact tracers from Riverside County. Let’s all do our part to stay healthy.

Big investments are being made today as part of Operation Warp Speed to develop COVID-19 treatments and vaccines. We must continue to keep our foot on the gas when it comes to health care solutions for this pandemic. https://t.co/rHE5Sb0mkX

Baseball players have returned to train in preparation for a 2020 season. If you’re like me and look forward to watching sports again it’s critical that you follow health guidelines to help stop the spread of COVID-19.

Riverside County has announced that residents interested in getting screened for COVID-19 at one of the several county-operated testing sites can now make an appointment online: https://t.co/4MFc5LMOzF

After questioning from House Republicans on the China Task Force WHO now concedes that China did not report the existence of the coronavirus in late 2019 despite its previous claims that it had. https://t.co/8pKU7DxM1s

Wearing a mask practicing social distancing and washing your hands are just some of the steps our local health officials are urging residents to take to help prevent the spread of COVID-19 and help our region safely re-open. https://t.co/KITO4duwqB

Earlier today I participated in a virtual event marking the establishment of a Tech Bridge between @NAVSEACorona and key industry and education stakeholders in the Inland Empire. This is a tremendous collaboration that will benefit our warfighters and our region.

As noted by the Coronavirus Task Force we are conducting 500k tests/day & there are no outstanding requests from any state for PPE or medical supplies. More than half of recent positive tests are people under 35. It’s critical for young adults to follow public health guidelines.

Contact tracing is critical to confronting the COVID-19 pandemic but privacy protections must be maintained. I signed a letter to @HHSGov asking for clear guidance on data privacy protections including for medical monitoring and proximity tracking involving smartphones. https://t.co/f0WgjsJrzN

Our community’s response to the COVID-19 pandemic continues to be truly inspiring. Do you know someone who is giving back stepping up or working on the front lines in response to the pandemic? Share their stories on this thread and tag them with #CA42Heroes

Earlier today the House of Representatives held a moment of silence to honor and remember the Americans who have lost their lives from COVID-19. Our nation grieves together with the families of those died.

The @CityofCorona will be receiving $3.9 million from the @FTA_DOT under funding made available by the CARES Act. The funds will be used to support Corona Cruiser fixed-route service and Dial-a-Ride demand-response service.

In addition to fighting for our freedom our military regularly carries out humanitarian and disaster relief missions around the world –including its significant role in response to the COVID-19 pandemic.

Positive #COVID19 tests conducted at public health labs are considered “presumptive positive” cases pending CDC confirmatory testing. Upon confirmation by the CDC they are then referred to as “confirmed positive.”
